intro: Loudetiopsis chevalieri, commonly known as the chevalier's loudetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a small, annual grass that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually greenish or brownish and are adapted for wind pollination. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in low-nutrient environments.
